data.title: Family History Gateshead County Durham 101
data.text:
Reed

I am searching for any relatives of my father, Charles Clive Reed b1916. His cousin was Ralph Penney who had a wife called Una. His sisters, Catherine and Joyce emigrated to Canada after WW2. Joyce married Albert and Catherine married Peter Litwiniuk/Litwincuik in the UK. They lived ibn Teeswater, Ontario, and had a son and a daughter who would be in their 50s now. Brason family

Looking for anestors of my great grandparents who lived at 7 Backfield Stree Gateshead in 1901. Margaret Brason (nee Young) was married to Cristopher Luke Hull Brason and they had several children. At least one of them, Christopher, moved to Canada. However, I am not sure I have the right Brason family. Swanson

I am seeking information about William Swanson, born in Scotland in 1805. In 1851 his occupation was listed as a Mustard Grinder. He was living at Abbots Old Yard, High Street, Gateshead with his wife Anne, and children William, Joseph, Elizabeth and Margaret. Also at this address on night of Census Mercy Monkhouse (Mother-in-law). Graham, geddes

Looking for Blanche (dob 1886)and/or Thomas Graham (dob 1888)both born in Gateshead to John and Alice (nee geddes) Graham (both dob 1861)- married in Haltwhistle 1883 Family returned to to Haltwhistle when father was killed on duty (police officer) Also looking for Father to John Graham (if indeed he was a Haltwhistle man by birth?) Charlton/Gofton/Blackett/Bainbridge/Thirlaway

I have a copy of a marriage by Banns for Anthony (Ralph) Blackett Charlton and Mary Ann Bainbridge dated Sept 30, 1844 in the parish of Whickham in the County of Durham. Fathers names are Edward Charlton (Sailor) and John Bainbridge (Keelman). Harry and Jane Bainbridge were the witnesses. I have since found that Edward married Elizabeth Blackett in 1810. Anthony had a son Edward (born 1852 in Gateshead, Whickham, Durham) who sailed to Canada shortly after his marriage to Mary Scafe Thirlaway in (1875). Anyone with any information about the extended families of any of these families I would be very grateful to correspond with you. Val Werving family

Looking for details of the family of Arthur Victor Werving and his wife Sarah, nee Brooks. He was a sailor from Sweden, she my great grandmother's sister. He was run over by a train in, I think, 1908 ish. Would be very grateful for any information on this or anything relating. Also to their neice and nephew, Mary Ann Brook and Thomas Horne. MILLEN

I believe the Millens were in Newcastle early 1800s, and then moved to Gateshead. Two Samuels cover the period 1820 to 1920 and John Isaac lived from 1879 to 1930. They were confectioners and had or were employed by a business in Oakwellgate, Gateshead at least until 1930. I have been told that their trademark was "Lucky Cross Sweets". Jordan Family

Marie Louise Plumpton nee Neil remarried in 1920 to Joseph Jordan a 29 year old general labourer. Marie was also 29 living 10 Oakwellgate. Gateshead. Joseph`s address was 5 Park Lane, Gateshead. Their son Thomas William Jordan was born 27.5.1924 at 30 Garden Street, Hull and died in 1995 in Hull. Looking for any other descendants of Marie and Joseph or of their son Thomas. Hetherington Isaac

I am trying to trace the Hetherington family from Blaydon, Gateshead, Durham. names I have are Isaac married to Eleanor, Thomas Moreland and his son Frederick Henry married to Annie Dixon. Any information would be most welcome. Robert Oliver

Robert Oliver (born 8 October 1824) s/o William and Elizabeth. Married Mary Hall 1846, children (1851 Census) Mary A. born 1847 and William 1850. Remarried 1858 to Dorothy Cook. Several more children. Was a coalminer then became a newsagent by 1871. Died 1899. Dorothy in 1911. Any information or contacts appreciated Milburn

Would like to make contact with anyone researching Milburns originating/living in Gateshead. I have John b.1904, John b.1878, John b.1848 and George b.1812 but am interested in the breadth of the Milburn family in this area. Regards, Bev Samuel Gillender/Gillander

I am trying to trace the ancestors of the above who moved to the Hertfordshire area and then settled in Poplar in the mid 1800's. He was born in 1832. Jane LOGAN

I'm looking for any information on Jane LOGAN from County Rosscommon, Ireland, who married Samuel POTTS possibly in 1852. They lived in Gateshead but married in Newcastle. Jane, her mother, also Jane, and brother Martin, were all born in Ireland; possibly Rosscommon. Samuel worked as a ropemaker and Jane also worked at the ropery for some time. Gattiss

I read that there is a person on this site looking for details re Gatiss family in Gateshead-I have a Henry Gatiis married to an Elizabeth Dobson, children Thomas,1866, William 1888, Henry 1890 and Mary 1892 from the Gateshead area. Burn family

Born in 1903 in Durham son of John Johnson BURN & Elizabeth YOUNG & in 1901 were living in Gateshead where his father was a Iron Turner He left England for Asutralia on the "Hobson Bay" in 1928 Any information would be great Helen Pearson Black

Can anyone help me find Pearson Black born at Gateshead 1901 son of Minnie Mckenzie and Joseph Black .Family could now live in the Kent area.He had a brother James would love help to make up my family tree nee Mckenzie Arrowsmith

Looking for Thomas Arrowsmith elder brother of John born to Cecilia Owen from Washington and John Arrowsmith Gateshead a cordwainer. John died soon after the birth of youngest John was born, I have a copy of his indenture to Master Mariner . Connections with Bruce family. Cecilia died at Johns home in Tynemouth and buried in St Mary's Gateshead, next to Sage Thomas Hall

looking for any info on THOMAS HALL came to New Zealand as a young boy about 1890 ,born in Gateshead ,Durham about 1881 marrieda Clara Grace O'Shannassy/ O'Shannessy. he was my great grandfather . had a sister Mary or this may have been his Mother. James Maghie

I am looking for the Maghie family who once lived at Scotsby Wetheral Cumberland .My grt grt grandfather James eloped to Gretna Green in 1847 to marry Anne Young They had nine children .My grt grandmother was one of their daughters born 1860 at Scotsby .James was a vet and I believe he died between 1888 and 1870 as I found his wife remarried a John Watson 1877 would love some help Crofton Family

I am looking for further information on my gt gt grandfather Isaac Bartholomew Crofton. The information I have is that he was born or christened in Gateshead in 1834. He married a Mary Ann Robson in 1858 and worked as a Chain Maker. They lived in Hood or Wood Row in Elswick and then Dunn Street, Elswick, Newcastle Upon Tyne. I would like futher information regarding Isaacs parentage. I know his father was called Robert and he was a tailor, originally from Gateshead, however I'm unsure of Isaacs mother's name, it could have been Pheobe ?? Sill Family

I am looking for further information on a Thomas Sill. The details I have are that he lived in Gateshead, he was married to Jane Sill, (maiden name unknown as yet) and he worked as a railway officer. Also he had a daughter called Jane who married a Joseph Sutherland, my great great grandfather in 1846. I would like to know where Thomas Sill was born and when and the maiden name of his wife Jane and I would also like to know if there was any connection with the 'Unthank' family. Greetham family

Looking for information of James and Fanny Greetham (nee Medd). 1891 Census shows them living in West Central Gateshead, Bonsham Cottage with his parents and siblings. James is a builder and was born in Scarborough. 1901 Census they are living in central Gateshead and have 4 children. James is shown to be a builder and contractor. Any info to further search would be great. Pattison family

Looking for information for family history on Pattison family. John and Elizabeth Anne (Medd) in 1881 and 1891 shows them in Dinnington Northumberland. 1901 Census shows them living in West Gateshead, Lyrell Street, with their family Annie E, William, Samson, John Richard, James Ernest, Albert and David. Any information to help with family tree would be great. family

Hi can any one help I am trying to find information on William Bramwell he was born 1798 he married Alice Wilkinson i think as she was married before to Thomas thompson they had a son his name was wilkinson Thompson then she Married william Alice was born in Darlington in 1807Married william in 1833 they had two children i think john and Hannha and i think Hannha married someone by the name of Denton.thank you Frances SHAW

Constance Shaw, born 1891 in Gateshead. One month old at time of 1891 Census. Living with a family called Fenwick in Trinity Street, Gateshead. Appears on 1901 Census as Constance Humphrey, aged 10, the ward of Robert Edward Vardy and his wife Frances (nee Fenwick). Does anyone have any further details? Searle / Richardson Gateshead

Looking for information on my great grandfather Andrew Searle b c 1884 married Margaret Bryce Richardson b 23Apr 1901. They married c 1919 and had 6 children: Isabella, Margaret, Muriel, Ann, Audrey & James. Andrew was a piper with the Northumberland Fusiliers during WW1. Later became a dock labourer. Andrew died in March of 1949 at 160 Beverley Rd, UD of tuberculosis. Any information on Andrew or his ancestors greatly appreciated. McGargle, Leonard, and Lamb.

I am looking for information on the above families who settled in Gateshead but who came from Ireland. The Lamb famiy I only know of Mary born about 1843 but I would also like to find out more about the other two. Greenwood or Searle

Herbert Henry Greenwood b1894 married Mary Searle my grandmother born c1897. they had three sons Gilbert,Herbert, James (my Father)they moved to London, Gilbert and Herbert are now deceased James now 85 still alive. I would like to find out more information on either Searle or Greenwood families Bell, Lancaster, Oddy, Simpson, Tate Watson, Wood,

Does anyone know of John WATSON born abt 1840 Gateshead. His parents were Ralph Watson & Margaret TATE. John married Hannah BELL. They had a daughter Margaret and a son James who married Louisa ODDY. They also had a daughter Sarah Jane Watson born in Elswick, Newcastle. She married John WOOD in Elswick. When Hannah died, John marreid a widow Sarah SIMPSON whose maiden name was LANCASTER. Willing to share info I have. Thanks. SMEATON

Looking for info on my smeaton side of family...i have James smaeton married elizabeth young 1855 sunderland james was boiler builder. His father was also called james smeaton and was an engineer. They had son named james william smeaton in 1962. Thompson

I'm looking for information about Thomas Thompson born 17/10/1845 in the village of Whitewell, Parish of Kelloe, County Durham. His father was Thomas Thompson born circa 1800, and his mother was Sarah Fairless.Thomas (of Whitewell) married twice, firstly Isabella Irwin, and then Eleanor Francis Wade. There was one child by the first marriage, and eight by the second. Thomas died 06/04/1910. He was a mining enginner. The family had connections with a mineral water company in Gateshead, and owned houses in Gateshead, which were rented out.They also were members of a Primative Methodist Chapel in Gateshead, where I believe Thomas played the organ. Can anyone help, please? John Gregory McGurk

Chasing descendants of a John Gregory McGurk born 1906 Durham. Father was a Francis McGurk and mother an Emily, we think Dixon-Chapman. John married an Ellen and lived in Co Bensham and we think had sons, John born c1932 and Francis born c1934. Thanks Eleanor... Turnbulls of Northumberland

Looking for any family of Edith Turnbull my GGGmother she had around 13 children and had a shop in Gateshead then moved to Bedlington with her second husband after her first one died. MY Grandmother was Olive Maud Hogan Forster

My grandfather Thomas B Forster was born 1845 his father was Robert Forster mother Mary. Robert I believe was born about 1816 in Chester-le-Street I can not go any further back. Thomas B Forsterwas born in Gateshead & married a Martha (late Newman) Greening in 1890 at Newcastle Cathedral Looking for Richard Renwick b c 1805 in Gateshead and Family

I am looking for the family of Richard Renwick he was a chainmaker, he had a son James renwick b c 1832 who was an iron moulder. Richard may have married a Margaret Boulton Newcastle 1826, then Elizabeth Lisle 1835 Newcastle. have dates for these marriages and the church but need to tie it togethr to see if the right family. other children could be Robert b 1830, Ann 1829, Richard 1835 mary 1840. do any of these names mean anything to you. Cusworth

Looking for information on the Cusworth. James Cusworth (born 1815) marreid to Adah Grant (1839)is my G.G.G Grandfather. His father was John, but there is where my trail ends. I need to know how family came to Newcastle and from where. My G.Grandfather John George moved back to Newcastle in late 1890's from London and had 2 sons George (born 1899) & Frederick (born 1901) to Ada Margaret Weir. Sadly Ada died and my G.Grandfather remarried Lillian and he died in 1934 in Whitley. Would like to know what has happened to George & his family, as cannot trace in records (Frederick was my Paternal Grandfather and he died before I was born in 1955ish). FELTON and ATKINSON

Looking for relatives of Elizabeth Felton who lived in Gateshead area around 1900.She married Robert Atkinson and their children were Hannah,Joey died age 2-3yrs,Thomas,"Ginger" and Barbara who died at 6weeks old. Believe Elizabeth Felton buried Bishop Aukland. She may have died around 1904. Smeaton Family

I want to trace this name back to 1700 if possible. My great great grandfather was William Milburn Smeaton born 14 January 1828 and married 12 July 1846 in Gateshead. M certificate shows father as James Smeaton (engineer) Can anyone tell me if James Smeaton originated in Gateshead or as IGI records suggest, he came from Kibworth Beauchamp in Leicester? Barnaby, Rose Street Gateshead

Hi - I am trying to track down any of my maternal family tree who lived in Rose Street, Gateshead. My Grandfather was Samuel Robert Barnaby (born 1921) and his mother was Charlotte Barnaby (no details known)- she had other sons (Ratio and Arthur). I believe Charlotte's first husband was killed at a local gas works and she re-married Jimmy Beattie. Any info would be much appreciated. Archbold Family

I'm seeking family information from the middle of th 19th Century on. I know the family (my grandfather Robert Archbold) was in Gateshead from c1890 on - but have no more detail. Any information would be welcome. McCALLUM Family

Would like to hear from anyone with information on or connections to the McCallum family. What I have to date is:- John David McCallum born Durham 1862 (father Barnard McCallum) married Esther Jobson in 1882. They had 7 known children; Annie, Rose, Barnard, Thomas, John, James, and Esther. The surname has been seen spelt as McCallum/McCallam/McCallan. Douglas --Ingram --Charlton

Searching for information about Hannah Charlton born C.1830 in Duston Gateshead.She married Thomas Ingham and had a least one child Mary Ann in 1855,she married Geo.Henry Douglas at Harton Colliery South Shields.Could anybody help please. howe

my gr.grandfather, william howe was living with his wife lucy frost howe, and their children, in gateshead, in the 1881 census. he was a recorder of b.d.m for his area. they were gone by 1891.I haven't found them again in that census, though the family was still in the area in 1947 when my father married my mother in australia.His parents lived at north rd, east boldon. I'd like to know any history concerning them. Thanks, Lee Teams Gateshead

Anyone know of Mr James Perry, late of Rose Street, who worked at the Coke Works, Teams Gateshead, for many years, or his wife Mrs Francis Jane Perry, nee Moss. Both of whom died in the early 1950s. HARTLEY BROWN

does anyone remember Thomas Hartley dob 18.05.1904 and his wife Mary nee Brown.I feel sure they lived in Gateshead in 1936, soon moving to Carlisle 1941 circa, where my father Brian was born.Mary left Carlisle, to return to North East? They had 3 daughters, Kathleen, Joyce and Margaret. Mary died circa 1980, not sure where. Fraser, Born Gateshead 1857

Trying to find relatives of William Jackson Fraser and his first wife, Emma Jane Fawcett, born 1865 in Stockton on Tees. They were married here in 1882 and then moved to Gateshead. Williams dad was John Simon Fraser and his mum Jane. I have info after 1881 but nothing before. Would welcome any assistance in finding them. Surname: Stewart

I am seeking information on a William Stewart: born on 1-feb-1894. He had an elder brother Archibald and a younger sister Sarah. Their parents were James Stewart and Hannah Hewitson. This family lived at St Leonard's Crt, Gateshead. Hunter, Gateshead, County Durham

Looking for information about the family of Margaret Young Hunter, b. circa 1864 in Gateshead. She later married Cornelius Moody of Holy Island. I believe Young may have been her mother's maiden name. Any information gratefully received. Surname Rogers

Searching for Thomas Rogers born around 1852 or 1853 in Gateshead according to 1891 census. His father is recorded on his marriage certificate as John Rogers a pot printer. Thomas married Elizabeth Pollard and settled in South Shields where he is buried. Any information welcome.
